intro: Brandegea parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered brandegea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
